sentences.english: Mr. Smith, a very white man, but a very yellow one.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生是位忠實可靠的人，但他很膽怯。

sentences.english: Third, the law or regulation needs to be faithfully implemented by the central government.
sentences.chinese: 第三，該法律或法規必須由中央政府忠實地推行。

sentences.english: He entrusted his child to a faithful friend.
sentences.chinese: 他把他的孩子委託給一位忠實的朋友照料。

sentences.english: She was a devoted admirer of "The Dream Journey.
sentences.chinese: 她是《夢幻之旅》忠實的崇拜者。

sentences.english: De Gaulle was, at that time, considered a disloyal soldier.
sentences.chinese: 當時戴高樂被看作是一個不忠實的軍人。

sentences.english: I've been a faithful public servant all my life.
sentences.chinese: 我一生都是一名忠實的人民公僕。

sentences.english: He was very faithful and honest.
sentences.chinese: 他的本性就是忠實，非常忠厚。

sentences.english: Meg and Jo fed their mother like dutiful young storks.
sentences.chinese: 麥格和裘像一對忠實的小鸛似地喂她們的母親。

sentences.english: To talk or act insincerely or misleadingly; equivocate.
sentences.chinese: 不忠實地或誤導地說或做。

sentences.english: Their marriage turned sour due to his infidelities.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他的不忠實，使得他們的婚姻關係變壞。

sentences.english: Berel had remained true to the old orthodoxy.
sentences.chinese: 斑瑞爾一直忠實格守古老的正統觀念。

sentences.english: This pub has many loyal customers.
sentences.chinese: 這間酒吧有許多忠實的老主顧。

sentences.english: I think the key to translating is not to get hung up on the literal meaning.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲翻譯的關鍵是一定要忠實表達它的原義。

sentences.english: He became a faithful restoration dynasty pawns .
sentences.chinese: 他成了復辟王朝的忠實走卒。

sentences.english: He was loved by millions of fans around the world, and had a mass of fortune.
sentences.chinese: 他在全球有百萬計的忠實粉絲，同時又財富五車。

definition: to like/to love/to be fond of/favorite
bean vermicelli/mung bean starch noodles/Chinese vermicelli/cellophane noodles/CL:把[ba3]/fan (loanword)/enthusiast for sb or sth
to own exclusively/unique to/specific/there is only
regarding/as far as sth is concerned/with regards to
to stand out from the masses (idiom)
